_header: To have in mind calling to remembrance
_description: On the Miseries occasioned to England by the Lancastrian Kings — fourteen 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

SocAnt101.First Lines:
To haue in mynde callyng to RemembraunceThe gret wrongys doon of
                    oold AntiquiteVnrightful heyres by wrong AlyaunceVsurpyng this Royaume
                    caused gret Aduersite…
SocAnt101.Last Lines:
…That they may for a good way & duratiounTo make peas in
                    Engeland þat Riche & pouirMay Ioyfully synge at the
                    conclusyonWelcom euerlastyng Ioye and fare wel langeure
SocAnt101.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Political Poems and Songs relating to English History, composed during
                the period From the Accession of Edward III to that of Richard III.
             2 vols. 
             Rolls Series

                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 222-6.
